lexUnit.name: abandonment.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: the act of relinquishing to no one

sentence.text: He told an audience at Stockholm 's stock exchange : ` The abandonment of the project enables all concerned to replan accordingly .
What a contrast with Mr Major 's abandonment of policy and principle after his costly Black Wednesday defeat .
Your advice entails the abandonment of our entire project .
Hopefully this approach may avoid the extremes of complete abandonment of dietary principles on the one hand and obsessional self-denial on the other .
They seem bewildered by President Reagan 's abandonment of an energy-saving policy and uncertain about what to say on key issues .

In the UK the new instability of exchange rates and international financial markets was followed , in 1976 , by the abandonment of Keynesian policies to sustain full employment and , since 1979 , by changes in the roles of the state , management and trade unions in influencing ( regulating ) the pace and direction of production and growth .

Although the Channel Tunnel Company set up during the 1880s survived the abandonment of the project , the pro-tunnel lobby had little success over the next 40 years despite a rash of Bills in Parliament and an inquiry by the Committee of Imperial defence in 1913 .

The assurance eventually came from the ARC literally minutes before the final deadline set by the Task Force for their abandonment of the project , and their promise to publicly disclose their reasons .
The abandonment of the project , which cost the Exchange 75 m and City firms preparing for it a lot more , cost 220 direct employees and another 130 contractors their jobs .
If the cost of a practical system was the abandonment of the guiding principle of the law of trusts , so be it .

Moreover , the ideological shifts that did occur can be seen to be consistent outgrowths of earlier party positions ; they did not represent , as contemporary propagandists liked to suggest , an abandonment of previous principles .

Munich became synonymous in Nizan 's vocabulary with the abandonment of the principles of collective security , the deliberate mystification of nation states , appeasement , acquiescence and capitulation to fascist oppression and death .

The abandonment of the 1973-1975 project did not dent the enthusiasm of the pro-tunnel lobby for long and agreement was reached with Kent County Council to keep the British terminal site free from further development .
